message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. It's a one-of-a-kind item that I think you'll love. I'm willing to sell it to you for $110.
Thank you for offering the product, Alice. I appreciate your generosity. I would like to propose a price of $95 for the product.
Thank you for your offer, Bob. I appreciate your interest in the product. However, I'm not willing to go as low as $95. I'm willing to meet you halfway and sell the product to you for $105.
I understand your position, Alice. I'm willing to pay $100 for the product, which is the maximum I'm willing to spend.
I appreciate your willingness to pay $100, Bob. However, I'm still not willing to sell the product at that price. I'm willing to compromise and sell it to you for $108.
I'm sorry, Alice, but I can't accept $108. I'm willing to pay $100 for the product, which is my maximum budget.
I understand that you're sticking to your budget, Bob. I'm willing to make one more concession. I'll sell the product to you for $107, which is as low as I'm willing to go.
I appreciate your effort, Alice. I'm still only willing to pay $100 for the product. This is my final offer.

I understand that you're firm on your price, Bob. However, I'm not willing to sell the product to you for $100. I'll make one more offer: I'll sell the product to you for $106, which is the lowest price I'm willing to accept.
Thank you for your offers, Alice. I appreciate your efforts. I'm unable to increase my offer beyond $100. I hope we can find a solution that works for both of us.
